III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 - Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
1

intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/1/25, a youth at the facility felt unsafe because a staff
member threatened to punch the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 03/11/2025 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional concerns regarding
Youth A and Staff 1.
On 03/12/2025 an interview was completed with Compliance and
Program Manager at Whaley. They were advised of the newly
assigned Special Investigation and informed of the allegations. It
was confirmed that Staff 1 did not have any disciplinary action in
his file and was referenced as a “very good” staff person.
Compliance denied receiving any reports of concerns from youth
or other staff regarding Staff 1.
The following interviews took place at Zonta on 3/12/2025
unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with Youth A. She reported she
wanted to call her worker and Staff 1 told her he was “going to
stop her”. She reported that Youth B also heard it. Youth A
stated she “kind of” thinks he was joking; the way he said it
seemed like he could have been joking. Youth A denied Staff 1
threatened her and again said if he said anything, he probably
was joking. Youth A reported she has never heard Staff 1
threaten any other youth or speak negative to other youth. Youth
A denied that she feels uncomfortable around Staff 1 and reported
feeling safe at Zonta. Youth A denied that other staff were around
and heard Staff 1 say that he was going to stop her from using the
telephone.
An interview was completed with Youth C. She denied hearing
Staff 1 use profanity, threaten to hit a youth. Youth C reported
Staff 1 has never said anything negative to her. Youth C
described Staff 1 as a “pretty good staff” and rated him as a 9 on a
scale of 10.
2

An interview was completed with Youth B. She denied hearing
Staff 1 threaten Youth A. She denied she has ever heard Staff 1
use profanity or make threats to any youth in the program. She
ended her interview by stating Staff 1 is a “good staff” and does
not curse.
An interview was completed with Youth D. She denied hearing
Staff 1 make threats toward youth or use profanity. She stated
Staff 1 is a good staff and anyone that made these statements are
“lying on him”.
An interview was completed with Staff 6 and Staff 3. Both staff
denied knowledge of or hearing Staff 1 make threats toward youth
or use profanity.
On 03/25/2025 a voicemail message was left for FCW requesting
a return call with any concerns regarding Youth A or with
placement at Zonta.
The following interviews were completed on 03/28/2025 via
telephone unless otherwise noted.
A phone interview was completed with Staff 4. She denied ever
hearing Staff 1 use profanity or make threats toward youth in the
program.
A phone interview was completed with Staff 5. She denied ever
hearing Staff 1 use profanity or make threats toward youth in the
program.
A phone interview was completed with Staff 2 and Staff 7. Both
denied knowledge of Staff 1 using profanity toward the youth or
threatening any of the youth in the program.
A voicemail message was left for Staff 1 requesting a return call
to discuss his employment at Zonta.
On 04/15/2025 a phone interview was completed with Staff 1. He
denied using profanity toward any of the youth in the program and
also denied making a threat to hit any youth; specifically Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
Whaley Physical Intervention Policy – indicates any type of
physical punishment including but not limited to: iv. Verbal abuse
including the use of derogatory or discriminatory language
3

including negative references to a youth’s background or
appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Tour of Agency:
A tour of Zonta was completed on 03/12/2025. No areas of
concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule 4158-1-a-iv. Interviews were
completed with both staff and youth at the agency and there was
no evidence to support allegations of Staff 1 using profanity
toward youth or behaving in a manner to make youth
uncomfortable.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
